I paid 16 euros for an appetizer and a main course. They also have a sand pit for petanque and a foosball table downstairs.

name: Little Parmentier
reviews:
I had the fish and chips and my wife had the Carnard.  Food was delicious but I am going to echo what others have said, the owner is super friendly, warm and welcoming.  I would gladly come back based on that alone.  Highly recommended for both food and atmosphere.; Am not sure I went to the right Little Parmentier if all the reviews are true!
The steak was rubbery, the salad was manky and the small glass of red was ‚Ç¨7. A real tourist trap! I shouldn't have entered when I saw the place completely empty!
Serves me right for placing my trust in these reviews!; Our first dinner experience in Paris and it was wonderful. The gentleman that was front of house was so nice and helpful. Food itself was also wonderful, cook on the beef was absolutely perfect.; The food is  very good and familiar.
The boss is nice and friendly and the ambiance is calm and relaxed...
The prices are moderate and we can choose some good artisanal beers. We feel at home!; One of the best restaurants in Paris

name: YUMAN bar et restaurant
reviews:
The waitstaff was very courteous and happy to accommodate French or English.  The drinks were are standouts and very refreshing.   It was easy to enjoy our conversation and our food.  I highly recommend the cucumber gazpacho.   Excellent!  We ordered different dishes and enjoyed them immensely.  Thank you for a fresh and delicious meal! I‚Äôd definitely come again.; Given the many choices Paris offers concerning places to eat dinner, choosing the place to settle can be quite the challenge. Luckily the Fork helped us out with an amazing deal. At first caution is advised when deals seem too good to be true, however, we were pleasantly surprised by the food, atmosphere and charming server (and probably owner). In regards to the actual dinner, the food consisted of classics presented in a modern way whilst also offering some newer dishes. Luckily this restaurant understood the importance of A-grade ingredients as simple recipes were very tasteful. Given the size of Paris, accessibility is very important as well. Given that there is a metro station just across the street, reaching Yuman should give little issues even when situated in the centre like we were. In our eyes, the owner and staff of Yuman understood the message of what good food and service meant and thus we could absolutely recommend this restaurant!; As someone who isn't really into vegan and organic restaurants, I gotta say I really loved the food here, good portions and the price was reasonable; Very healthy and tasty food. They use only biological ingredients. I find their prices are quite expensive compared to other places I know.; Very nice place, with stunning atmosphere and decoration. Super nice staff, that chatted with us and answered our million questions!
Great place, both for the organic food and suitable aura.

name: Le Corner
reviews:
this place was absolutely amazing. i found it online and decided to give it a go. the food was flavorful and hearty, i had the duck breast which was cooked to a perfect medium and paired very well with the soft baguette. the real star of the show was our waiter. when we first came in he greeted us, he sang songs, and was overall super energetic and kind. after finishing our meal me and my mom left early to go and catch the eiffel tower sparkling, leaving my father to pay at the restaurant. our waiter was so concerned that we had a fight and dramatically left that he gave my dad chocolates (pictured in the photos below) and offered him a amaretto. quality service really goes a long way and le corner fully delivered. go here!!; Filet de rumps track was EXTREMELY GOOD. The waiter was so nice, we came after 10pm, the kitchen was still open and he was very friendly during our whole time here. The table next to us ordered the burgers and they also looked very good.; This restaurant has a lovely atmosphere. The food was impeccable. We were two people and shared an entr√©e, had mains, finished with a dessert and had a bottle of wine. The whole meal was under 85‚Ç¨ which is fantastic. All waiters, especially Amir, were great. Smiling and making us feel at home.  We finished our Paris trip here and it was a great way to wrap up our visit to this beautiful city.; Went here for dinner.
Ordered the escargot which was amazing.
The waiter recommended the entrecote de boeuf which was lovely.
The waiter also suggested some nice red wine which went very well.
The service was excellent, despite my terrible french, the waiter helped me as lot.
Overall, great experience, amazing food, wine and service.
Merci.; Staff were lovely, attentive, informative and friendly, the food was all excellent and we couldn‚Äôt fault it. Starter, main and dessert were all delicious!
We even had three desserts because we couldn‚Äôt decide and all three were delicious! We spent under ‚Ç¨100 and that got us both two glasses of wine, a bottle of still water, a starter, main and dessert each, plus another dessert as mentioned!
Simply incredible.
Also upon ordering wine I‚Äôm not expert and the waiter helped me decide. He suggested a red and it was absolutely delicious! They then also wrote it down so I could buy it when I get home.
We would highly recommend it and we would happily return over and over again. We will be suggesting to our friends who visit Paris.
Faultless.

**5 Stars - Amazing Spot!**

name: Le P'tit Piano
reviews:
Great food and service! The staff were nice and friendly. We got their sirloin steak with shallot cream and one with morel (mushroom) sauce, and duck breast. We also got the creme brulee, lemon tart and chocolate fondant with ice cream for dessert.; We loved everything here!
The service was great and we were greeted by a smile as soon as we arrived.

Food came out super quickly and was delicious. Great portion as well, so great value for money. Cocktails were tasty and refreshing for these hot summer afternoons.

100% recommend.; Alfredo is great! The dishes he recommended were surprisingly good. We ordered the lamb, goat cheese salad, charcuterie board, and French onion soup. Give this place a try!; We decided to try this place out after seeing all the fantastic reviews, but upon arrival, we almost thought we were at the wrong place‚Äîit looked almost like a PMU from the outside! However, stepping inside changed our minds instantly. The interior is surprisingly cute, and it was bustling with energy during our Saturday brunch visit.

There's even a piano set up for their piano nights, adding a charming touch. The staff was incredibly friendly, which made our experience even better.
The food? Absolutely delightful. I had the foie gras and salade p√©rigourdine as starters, which were hearty enough to be mains, followed by the succulent souris d‚Äôagneau. The portions were generous across the board, definitely making it worth the money.

I would heartily recommend this spot and affirm that it truly deserves its high ratings, especially for the quality of the cuisine.; Amazing little gem. Very good food. No big problem was tasty nonetheless!

name: Good Lunch
reviews:
Very good quality and tasty food, above else better than the competition in that intersection (those big franchises), that's something!
Friendly and polite personnel.; Good food, good people; The worst kebab I ever had in France‚Ä¶.; I got what I was looking for - good food for good price, nothing fancy.; Corerect

name: Cafe Louise
reviews:
We came here for brunch on a Sunday. It‚Äôs ‚Ç¨38 per person, including a juice (freshly squeezed or detox juice), a coffee, a choice of either waffle or savory tart, and bottomless fruits and desserts from the buffet table. name: Candide
reviews:
Excusez mon anglais‚Ä¶ this restaurant was delightful. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the food was delicious and healthy and the owner was incredibly sweet to our group. I hope that word gets around and this restaurant gets the credit it deserves.
It‚Äôs a bit pricey but I‚Äôd say that the cost is fitting of the quality of the food and the ingredients. As we were eating I knew I wanted to write a review and when my meal came it looked so good I completely forgot to take a photo but I can assure you it was amazing. I had the trout and I highly recommend this if you like fish. We had the mussels and anchovies for an entree (photos) and the Fromage plate for dessert.
Really loved this place.; What a great spot!! Love the vibes. Good portion. Great flavors. Amazing wines. Totally worth it!! Our favorite was the duck and the gnocchi.; Candide, a charming restaurant nestled in the heart of Paris, offers an unforgettable dining experience that is sure to delight even the most discerning palate. From the moment you step inside, you are enveloped in a warm and inviting atmosphere that sets the stage for a truly exceptional meal.

The menu at Candide showcases a remarkable fusion of classic French cuisine and modern culinary techniques, resulting in a symphony of flavors that are both innovative and comforting. Each dish is thoughtfully crafted, showcasing the freshest ingredients and artful presentation that elevates the dining experience to new heights.

The attentive and knowledgeable staff at Candide create an environment of genuine hospitality, ensuring that each guest feels welcome and well cared for. Their passion for fine dining and commitment to providing an outstanding experience is evident throughout the meal.

Candide is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a memorable and enchanting culinary experience in Paris. With its exquisite menu, elegant ambiance, and exceptional service, this charming restaurant is the epitome of Parisian dining at its finest.

p.s. there is a secret in one of the cabinets; To be avoided, the food was tasteless, the pork dry and the wine not good. Plus super expensive for what it is (more than 70 euros per person). The restaurants on rue Belleville are much better and original, and at a fraction of the price. The waiters were nice though.; Waitress very rude and agressive, rolled her eyes when I had a question about the menu. She kept trying to remove the plates before it was finished. The people in the table next to us were also disturbed by her. She also charged us for multiple items we didn‚Äôt order, I only realized when I got home..

name: Les Enfants Rouges
reviews:
This is a cozy little, very compact restaurant in a busy little street of Paris. The food (in my opinion) is good but did not blow my mind nor did I have a gastronomical experience. Its just one of those places that gets popular I guess. The restaurant is really compact and space is scarce to move around. The service is very good, attentive, helpful and prompt. The five stars are for the great service really and not so much for the food - I have had better. Reservations are required in advance as it gets busy. It seems overpriced to me.; Our second time in Les Enfants Rouges was interesting. Definitely reserve your table in advance, the place is packed. Cozy atmosphere. Staff is super nice. Neither of the entries deserve a mention, thus 4 stars.; Definitely a 5-star and particularly at the reasonable price. Dishes from Les Enfants Rouge and chef-patron Da√Ø Shinozuka. With one bottle of wine, the cost was just under ‚Ç¨100 a head.
The first time we came was about ten years ago. Standards have not dropped and its popularity is understandable - so book in advance. Five stars! (And the service was good too.); A must stop by place if you‚Äôre in Paris. Modern French cuisine, with a Japanese twist. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the dishes were art pieces. Very friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. Reservation recommended! Great selection of drinks including Japanese cocktails and sake üëå; Blown away by the quality of the lunch course, especially compared to the price. This place at least deserves a bib gourmand imho. The grapefruit lychee dessert was such an ideal assembly of tart, crisp, and sweet - and the textures! name: L'EXPOSITION

name: Bistrot M√îM

The prices are reasonable & the service is great. Had a birthday here and did not dissapoint. reviews:
The food is okay and tasty, although I was not convinced by some combinations. An outdoor area is available and is not far from the metro line. The wine is good; Great healthy food! The vegetables had that great grandmother farm taste and the place has a great atmosphere. A very nice terrace and good background music to enjoy a great meal.; A little hidden gem in the bissyness of the east of the city
Great food and a nice selection on the menu
Portions are large and very well priced,
Will visit again when I am back in Paris

name: Little Apple
